paragraph.act: lifting | moving | placing | assembling | pack disassembling
paragraph.htmltext:
In the defined life cycle process damaged packs can occur after the module assembly and before pack assembly, and during pack disassembling.

Damaged modules have a higher risk on thermal runaway. Wherever damaged modules are handled, the temperature of the modules need to be checked frequently to detect the start of thermal runaway. The modules self need to be separated from each other by moulded trays.
If damaged packs are handled in the module assembly insulated tools are required together with the covering of the connector to avoid external short circuit.
